intro: Crotalaria barkae subsp. teitensis, commonly known as the Teit Island crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Teit in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is adapted to coastal and sandy environments, showcasing halophytic traits that allow it to thrive in saline conditions. Its bark is fibrous and contains alkaloids, which may have medicinal or toxic properties. The subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
